item.title: Ticket #17537 (TinyMCE mangles <map></map> construct) created
item.dc:creator: vdhamer
item.description:
I entered the following in TinyMCE HTML mode. When I switch from HTML mode to Visual mode and back to HTML mode, I see that the code has been mangled. Saving it and viewing it confirms that the Map is now broken.

This happens in the 3.2 beta nightly. I double checked that it doesn't happen in the 3.1.2 version.

Original and intended HTML input

Note the 3 <area>s defined inside <map> 

<p style="text-align: center;"><img class="aligncenter size-full
wp-image-3438" src="Home3.jpg" alt="" width="940" height="880"
usemap="#homepagemap" /></p>
<map name="homepagemap">
  <area shape="rect" coords="15,15,75,95" href="hrefA" title="textA"/>
  <area shape="rect" coords="82,15,142,95" href="hrefB" title="textB"/>
  <area shape="rect" coords="147,15,207,95" href="hrefC" title="textC"/>
</map>

Mangled output

There are now 3 <area>s defined in 3 separate <map>s with the same name. This is incorrect. 

<p style="text-align: center;"><img class="aligncenter size-full
wp-image-3438" src="Home3.jpg" alt="" width="940" height="880"
usemap="#homepagemap" /></p>
<map name="homepagemap"> <area title="textA" shape="rect"
coords="15,15,75,95" href="hrefA" /></map>
<map name="homepagemap"> <area title="textB" shape="rect"
coords="82,15,142,95" href="hrefB" /></map>
<map name="homepagemap"> <area title="textC" shape="rect"
coords="147,15,207,95" href="hrefC" /></map>

item.title: Ticket #17512 (admin-bar CSS causing print problem) updated
item.dc:creator: nacin
item.description:
Keywords changed

Anyone see an issue with screen being used as an implied implied "not print"? While there are other media types, I don't think we should have an issue -- but just checking.

We could also override our own CSS in the style media="print" that does the actual hiding of the admin bar.

Marking for commit rather than actually committing as I don't have IE6 handy to be able to actually test IE + GCF.

item.title: Ticket #17536 (stray closing tags printed by wp_plugin_update_row if ...) updated
item.dc:creator: nacin
item.description:
Milestone changed

Replying to mitchoyoshitaka:

Note this hook was intended (#9553) to be fired only when there actually is an upgrade notice being printed, so it can be safely moved into the conditional.

Based on my review, I agree.

item.title: 17536.diff attached to Ticket #17536
item.dc:creator: mitchoyoshitaka

item.title: Ticket #17536 (stray closing tags printed by wp_plugin_update_row if ...) created
item.dc:creator: mitchoyoshitaka
item.description:
Seems a little contrived, but if current_user_can('update_plugins' ) and !is_network_admin() and is_multisite(), wp_plugin_update_row may be triggered for a plugin.

wp_plugin_update_row will then skip the block which prints <tr><td><div> and the upgrade message, but will still print the closing </div></td></tr> after calling the in_plugin_update_message-$file hook. Note this hook was intended (#9553) to be fired only when there actually is an upgrade notice being printed, so it can be safely moved into the conditional.

item.title: Ticket #17534 (Glitch with collapsed menus) updated
item.dc:creator: ocean90
item.description:
Another video: ​http://www.screenr.com/CMj

The problem is, that the menu opens above the icon but closes on the original position (next to the icon).

item.title: Ticket #17324 (UI Style Update) updated
item.dc:creator: nacin
item.description: They're all different interactions and user experiences, so let's not conflate them.

item.title: Ticket #17324 (UI Style Update) updated
item.dc:creator: ocean90
item.description:
In my opinion we should standardize the behaviour of the collapse arrows.

  • On the navigation the arrow is shown only when the menu is open and hidden when it's closed.
  • On the metabox the arrow is hidden when the box is open and closed, so only visible on hover.
  • The arrow for screen options and contextual help is always there. The orientation will be changed on a click (Box open = arrow up, box closed = arrow down).
  • On the new dropdown menu for user info the arrow is always the same (arrow down).

item.title: Ticket #17534 (Glitch with collapsed menus) updated
item.dc:creator: scribu
item.description:
Yep, it's the scrollbar that's briefly appearing and causing the glitch.

Doesn't happen in WP 3.1, by the way.

item.title: Ticket #17534 (Glitch with collapsed menus) updated
item.dc:creator: ocean90
item.description: Because it's not visible in the video: Could be the scrollbar on the right the problem?

item.title: Ticket #16793 (Bulk inline post edit doesn't show categories or tags if the CPT ...) updated
item.dc:creator: somatic
item.description:
Cc changed

another casualty of this problem is that any javascript (and jQuery) that would be executed on the wp-admin/edit.php?post_type=foo screen can't run, as the javascript engine stops at that initial Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'firstChild' of null error. I had been adding some additional sorting options via jQuery, and couldn't figure out why they appeared on some post type edit lists, but not this one, until I found this ticket...

I can confirm that adding the supports => titles does fix the problem, but it's not absolute: I have two CPT, registered with basically identical args, and neither supports titles - but one manifests the javascript error on edit.php and the other does not...

item.title: Ticket #17534 (Glitch with collapsed menus) created
item.dc:creator: scribu
item.description:
Found a small glitch when switching menus, while on an admin list screen:

​http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JTuB4UsswDA

The tables briefly moves to the left, a little.

Reproduced both in Firefox 4 and Chrome.

From what I can tell, just before a menu is about to be hidden, it doesn't maintain it's vertical possition, but goes back next to the button before it slides in.

item.dc:creator: azaozz
item.description:
Replying to scribu:

I would rather leave it as cursor:default; but make the arrow go darker on hover. In all browsers the pointer is used for links, the arrow (default) cursor is used for controls and all default controls (look at the Submit button below) have hover effect.

item.title: Ticket #17533 (Incorrect wpdb class docs) created
item.dc:creator: johnbillion
item.description:
The inline docs for the wpdb class says: 

/**
 * WordPress Database Access Abstraction Object
 *
 * It is possible to replace this class with your own
 * by setting the $wpdb global variable in wp-content/db.php
 * file with your class. You can name it wpdb also, since
 * this file will not be included, if the other file is
 * available.

This is incorrect because wp-includes/wp-db.php is always included.

Patch coming up.

item.title: Ticket #16365 (Comment transition for new comments) updated
item.dc:creator: MattyRob
item.description:
Keywords changed

I've tested out my changes with a plugin containing the following code: 

function comment_transition($commentdata) {
	// put something in here to email when comments are made and see if we can report the hook used somehow
	$recipient = '<my email address here>';
	$subject = 'New to Spam hook';
	$mailtext = 'The "comment_new_to_spam" hook has been called';
	@wp_mail($recipient, $subject, $mailtext);
}
add_action('comment_new_to_spam', 'comment_transition');

On every new spam made on my site I got an email.

Can we commit now please?

item.title: foo.php attached to Ticket #17516

item.title: Ticket #16075 (Add Post Type Archives support in Nav Menus) updated
item.dc:creator: aaroncampbell
item.description:
Replying to travisnorthcutt:

Would it be viable to get at least some form of this in 3.2, and expand on it for 3.3?

We did. We added a filter in [17951] that would let a plugin do this exact thing. I'll release the plugin before 3.2 comes out (maybe this weekend if I get time).

item.title: Ticket #17532 (Credits screen: show translators, untranslatable string, generic ...) updated
item.dc:creator: nacin
item.description: We use add_css() in a number of other situations in core without issue. If a plugin defined that function, lots of things would break.

item.title: credits_translators.patch attached to Ticket #17532
item.dc:creator: dimadin

item.title: Ticket #17532 (Credits screen: show translators, untranslatable string, generic ...) created
item.dc:creator: dimadin
item.description:
• Since locale is already passed to request, translators can be shown in credits too. GlotPress can return list of validators for that locale. One installation can have more than one locale so transients should be based on locale.
  • String "Core Contributors to WordPress %s" is untranslatable since version is returned in response, instead placeholder must be returned.
  • Function add_css() has generic name so I think that it should be prefixed.

item.title: twentyeleven.patch attached to Ticket #17531
item.dc:creator: dimadin

item.title: Ticket #17531 (TwentyEleven i18n Improvements) created
item.dc:creator: dimadin
item.description:
Categories and tags lists shown in archives are not i18n friendly since they don't use placeholder and instead are broken to use the_category() and the_tags() function.

My fix is based on one from TwentyTen with addition of checks for | separator between lists and i18n of separator between lists items since we already have one in wp_sprintf_l().

Note to Automatticans (since they are original authors): I see that in your themes you have this hacks that work for English, so please always use placeholders and assume that in some language word order is different.

item.dc:creator: kawauso
item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: Ticket #17530 (Plugins sub-menu has wrong name under multisite site admin) created
item.dc:creator: kawauso
item.description:
[17864] introduced new sub-menu labels such as "All <x>" and "Installed Plugins", but under multisite the Plugins sub-menu has no other items and the label for the plugins page in the sub-menu is auto-generated from the parent.

In short, the label becomes just "Plugins" rather than "Installed Plugins" as on single site installs.

Steps to Reproduce:

  1. Activate Akismet or other plugin that adds a sub-menu item under the Plugins sub-menu
  2. Look at Plugins sub-menu

Related: #17528

item.title: Ticket #17378 (Rename submenus to not clash with top level menus) reopened
item.dc:creator: ocean90
item.description:
'Available Tools' sounds good for me.

Reopened for review.

Related: #17528

item.title: Ticket #17528 (Comments menu has sub-menu despite only having one item) updated
item.dc:creator: kawauso
item.description:
Replying to greuben:

See [17864]

My issue isn't with the sub-menu naming, but rather the UI implications of it being present for one item only. There is a related issue with the inheritance of top menu names for auto-generated sub-menus clashing though.

item.title: Ticket #17180 (Invalid published date insertion in posts) updated
item.dc:creator: solarissmoke
item.description:
Keywords changed

Ah, problem indeed. Here's a tentative patch - it disables the submit button until you click OK on the timestamp editor and the date is valid (this may need UI feedback), and issues an error server-side if an invalid date is supplied (for when JS is disabled).

item.title: Ticket #17312 (Contextual Help Tab Updates For Changed Features) updated
item.dc:creator: dougwrites
item.description:
Question: can we have specific help tab content for the new screens in 3.2? Credits is easy -- describe the functionality of creating a profile on wp.org/trac/codex/support forums. I put a draft up on #17384 but can move it here and put it in my omnibus patch.

It's better for consistency to have specific help tabs for all screens, but Freedoms has a counterargument: the only functionality is "follow the links" and anything to be said maybe should be visible (and already is) in the screen itself. This is in line with the position that the Freedoms screen should be there even in all site admins in a multisite network.

item.title: Ticket #17483 (Comments displayed multiple times in edit moderated comments screen) reopened
item.dc:creator: greuben
item.description:
[17965] broke custom-fields list table.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Edit a post
  2. Enter a custom field key and value then click 'Add custom field'
  3. The custom fields #list-table is not updated.
